description:
Hello Bristol Gophers 👋!

We're keeping our talks online for now. A zoom link will be added closer to the date.

Speakers:

🗣 Nick White - Using Fyne to create beautiful GUIs in idiomatic Go

Nick is a free software loving developer who has worked in a variety of weird jobs creating tools for academics in the humanities, currently working for the University of Oxford. He found Go about 4 years ago, and it has made him a happier human.

Nick will talk about using the Fyne toolkit to create native cross-platform desktop and mobile interfaces in pure Go.

We will walk through an example of adding a GUI in Fyne to an existing Go command line program, showing off a variety of widgets and customisation that's possible. We'll talk about the pros and cons of using a toolkit that has been built from the ground up for Go, as opposed to bindings for more well-known toolkits like Qt, GTK or Tk.

⏰ Schedule:

* 18:00-18:05 intro/welcome
* 18:05-18:35 first speaker
* 18:55-19:00 farewell/next event info

📣 We are looking for help with organising! If you or anyone you know would like to help, give us a shout! As you can see, our pun game especially is in dire need of some love.

📣Help us grow! JetBrains offers free licences to meet-ups with attendance greater than 30. If we can reach this, we will apply and be handing it out as a prize at events.

📍 - Online
title: Go(ne online) - Fyne
